alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 9:12PM PST until December 20 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Snow will transition to rain, and with well-below freezing road temperatures, this will result in difficult travel conditions Tuesday evening. * WHERE...Elevations above 5500 feet in the Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes Highways 140, 138, 62, and the Crater Lake area. * WHEN...From 10 AM to 10 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
